oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dee and Delta Hicks Part 1
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Audio files of Fentress County residents Dee Hicks and Delta Hicks recorded as part of the Tennessee State Parks Folklife Project. The Hicks family relates family stories and anecdotes involving hunting, fishing, farming, and cooking.

The contribution of Dee and Delta Hicks speaks to interests in folkways, foodways, and family anecdotes. The Tennessee State Parks Folklife Project began in 1979 under the direction of Park Ranger Bobby Fulcher and continued until 1983. Each summer during those years, three folklorists were stationed in Tennessee's state parks. From those bases, they conducted interviews, took photographs, and recorded music with local tradition-bearers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Parks Folklife Project Collection, 1979-1984
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Genealogy; Personal narratives; Foodways
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fulcher, Bobby
